Each full night of rest heals 2 of the unhealable damage, and a full day of bed rest increases the recovery to 4 of the unhealable damage.

Wolf (BB).name: Wolf (EB)
Wolf (BB).publicNotes: Wolves roam forests, hills, and other wild lands, where they live and hunt in packs. Contrary to popular belief, these packs aren't led by the strongest in the group, but typically consist of a mated pair, their pups, and juvenile offspring from previous mating seasons. Offspring generally leave their parents' pack upon reaching maturity, at which point they seek out mates of their own to form their own packs elsewhere. Wolves don't typically view humanoids as prey animals, but extraordinary circumstances can lead wolves to attack people, especially in winter months and other situations where traditional prey (such as deer and elk) are scarce.

action->Pack Attack.name: Rudelangriff
action->Pack Attack.description: The wolf's jaws Strike deals 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of two of the wolf's allies.

action->Knockdown.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]

When the wolf succeeds at its jaws Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the target. This Trip doesn't apply or count toward the wolf's multiple attack penalty.

Xulgath Leader (BB).name: Xulgath Leader (BB)
Xulgath Leader (BB).publicNotes: Xulgath leaders exhibit greater strength and more affinity for violence than other members of a xulgath community.

weapon->Greataxe.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8COlYvHe6hKCXY8x]

This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

armor->Breastplate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.r0ifJfoz8aqf0mwk]

Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

action->Stench.name: Stench
action->Stench.description: A creature that comes within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] of the xulgath and can smell the xulgath must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch. A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute (Use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}).

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: The xulgath boss makes two Strikes with their greataxe against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within their reach, with a +1 circumstance bonus. The second attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as the first, but attacks the xulgath boss makes after this take a -10 multiple attack penalty (or a -8 multiple attack penalty for its claw).

Xulgath Warrior (BB).name: Xulgathkrieger (EB)
Xulgath Warrior (BB).publicNotes: Die vielen Oberflächenbewohnern auch als Troglodyten bekannten Xulgathen greifen jeden Eindringling an, der ihr Revier betritt. Sie leben in Familienverbänden und bekämpfen andere Sippen und andere Bewohner der Tiefe, um zu überleben. Zuweilen überfallen sie angetrieben von grausamen und blutdurstigen Anführern auch Ortschaften an der Oberfläche. Ein typischer Xulgath hat stumpf-, dunkel- oder aschegraue Schuppen und einen langen Schwanz. Entlang dem Rückgrat wachsen knöcherne Auswüchse.

action->Stench.name: Gestank
action->Stench.description: A creature that comes within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] of the xulgath and can smell the xulgath must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch. A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute (Use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}).

Zephyr Hawk (BB).name: Windfalke (EB)
Zephyr Hawk (BB).publicNotes:
Air elementals, such as a zephyr hawk, appear in a variety of sizes and shapes. From the Plane of Air, zephyr hawks are often summoned to be used as airborne messengers. Air elementals can also arrive spontaneously during powerful storms and tornadoes where elemental vortexes form.

Zephyr hawks appear to be made of clouds, with distinct shapes that give them the appearance of having the wings and beaks of birds. When one sees clouds that resemble animals, they're often unknowingly observing air elementals. Zephyr hawks sometimes drift among wind currents in great flocks called casts.

action->Circling Attack.name: Kreisender Angriff
action->Circling Attack.description: The zephyr hawk flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn't trigger reactions like Reactive Strike. The second attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as the first, but attacks it makes after this take a -8 multiple attack penalty.

Zombie Shambler (BB).name: Zombieschlurfer (EB)
Zombie Shambler (BB).publicNotes: A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed. Among the living dead, zombies are most often used as fodder, wearing down defenses before more powerful undead arrive to deal the killing blow. Zombies can't truly think for themselves, but they can be commanded by other allied undead and powerful necromancers.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Biss
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Voraussetzung Der Zombie hat eine Kreatur @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Gegriffen} oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Gebunden}.

action->Slow.name: Langsam
action->Slow.description: Ein Zombie besitzt nur 2 Aktionen während seines Zuges und kann keine Reaktionen nutzen.

action->Grab.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]

When the zombie succeeds at its fist Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target. This Grapple doesn't apply or count toward the zombie's multiple attack penalty.
